meanings.definition: To divide into sections or categories
meanings.sent1: She is compartmentalizing her study materials for better organization.
meanings.sent2: He has a habit of compartmentalizing his work tasks to stay focused.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was compartmentalizing its nuts in different hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: Compartmentalizing your thoughts can help you manage stress effectively.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalizing your closet by color makes it easier to find clothes.

meanings.definition: To separate or isolate different aspects or parts of something
meanings.sent1: The detective is compartmentalizing the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: She is compartmentalizing her emotions to deal with the breakup.
meanings.sent3: The chef was compartmentalizing the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Compartmentalizing work and personal life can lead to a better balance.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalizing your worries can help you focus on the present moment.
